• Implement improvements to our existing end of line automation software Use results from full subassembly validation campaigns to write automation tests for new hardware from scratch Spend time on the manufacturing line understanding and responding to key pain points, including troubleshooting failures, improving visibility and debuggability, and increasing test coverage to catch downstream issues Develop user-friendly GUI screens for production technicians to operate Bachelor’s or higher degree in Software, Mechanical, Electrical, or Controls Engineering Strong proficiency in writing Python and C++ for interfacing with real hardware including actuators, sensors, relays, etc Experience with common embedded stacks: Debian Linux, Ethernet, USB, SPI, UART, SCPI Capable of reading and interpreting electronic circuit diagrams and integrating sensors and actuators Strong understanding of best practices in software engineering Manufacturing software experience Previous work on mobile robots.

• Mechanical and Electrical aptitude is a plus and must have potential to be developed by candidateAbility to work on a professional team with a willingness to learn and grow with the company.
• Prepare and submit reports as required to keep management updated on project status.
• Maintain and continually improve technical and professional abilities described above and required to perform assigned tasks.
• Proficiency in Office 365 Typically requires a bachelor's degree in engineering and five (5) to seven (7) years of related experience.
• Experience developing software applications or machine vision systems.
• Design, build and support software applications (C, C++, C#,.
• Design, build and support software library interfaces to common vision tools.
• Define sensors, lighting and optics for solving machine vision problems.

• 5+ years of software engineering experience Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field Mastery of C++, Python and Linux Experience implementing real-time software Good knowledge of computer architecture Deep understanding of communication buses and protocols like Ethernet, Ethercat, Serial, CAN or USB Comfortable using lab instruments (Oscilloscopes, logic analyzers…) and debugging tools (Lauterbach…).
• Experience with the Bazel build system Experience with Docker containers Experience implementing CI/CD infrastructures Familiar with Agile and Test driven development.

• Develop software systems to support large scale deployments of cloud servicesResponsible for contributing to multiple source code projects to fulfill NVIDIA requirements with software services Work and collaborate with engineering managers, architects, designers, and frontend engineers to deliver high quality software Automate the validate of software solutions with unit and integration testsParticipate in the ownership and health of CI/CD pipelines from dev to production environments Collaborate with other specialists for feedback on proposed designs and product direction Openly share successes and failures in a no blame environment BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience 5+ years of proven experience in large scale software development Experience building and shipping services on Kubernetes Background with using and chipping in to open-source projects Collaborated with teams to write software to support cloud services at scaleProgramming experience in a relevant language, e.
• Golang, PythonCommunicate design and quality strategy in written, visual, and oral formatsExperience with a wide range of modern infrastructure tools and technologies Experience with Kubernetes Cluster API, Terraform, Tinkerbell, and other infrastructure tooling Practical experience with Azure, GCP, or AWS Capable of refactoring software to run in systems such as Kubernetes Ability to discuss and work with CSI, CNI, and CRI Familiarity with the CNCF and the tooling across the ecosystem Upstream contribution in open source projects.

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or highly quantitative field.
• 0-4 years of industry experience Experience developing computer vision and image processing algorithms including: image filtering/preprocessing, frequency domain analysis, segmentation, object detection, classification, point set registration, 3D pose estimation, etc.
• Proficient in Python or MATLAB for rapid prototyping of algorithms Experience with one or more of the following libraries: OpenCV, Scikit-Image, MATLAB image processing toolbox.
• Experience with modern computer vision models such as: YOLO, ViT, DINO(v2), SAM(2) General software engineering skills: object-oriented design and experience with the git version control system.
• Experience with data analysis and visualization.
• Experience with machine learning: neural networks, support vector machines, ensemble learning.
• Must be a US Person (U.
• Citizen or Legal Permanent Resident) Master’s degree Strong background in statistics and machine learning fundamentals.

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field2+ years of experience in embedded software development with a focus on motor control, especially FOCProficiency in embedded software development using C and C++Strong understanding of electrical motors, control theory, and their correct applicationExperience with communication protocols like EtherCAT, CAN, SPI, I2C or others Architecture and firmware development for NEO's motors.
• Develop software for specific motor control requirements and applications.
• Understanding of electromagnetic design and robotic actuation principlesExperience in sensors (position, current, temperature,.

• Implement real-time control algorithms, safety mechanisms, and communication protocols (e.
